place.name: TREWEN
place.gazetteerText: TREWEN, a parish in Launceston district, Cornwall; 4½ miles W by S of Launceston r. station. Post town, Launceston. Acres, 988. Real property, £1,089. Pop., 178. Houses, 36. The property is much subdivided. The living is annexed to South Petherwin. The church is not good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
